Stealth and cunning were not the first words to not the first words to come to mind when describing Usagi Tsukino. The young, bubbly teenager tended towards loud outbursts of emotion (whether ear splitting cries of joy or even louder fits of crying), rushing from one place to another, and often catastrophic examples of coordination and reflex. It was only under the most dire of circumstances or important of tasks that could cause her to grow more serious and apply her focus to the subtle art of staying hidden and silent ambush. But sporadic as those moments might be, when the Sailor Senshi applied herself to the task she became quite formidable. In those moments, her enemies stood no chance.

Now she had her target in sight. The enemy was inching into position, unsuspecting. A moment of hesitation or miscalculation and her advantage would be lost completely. Usagi held her breath. Just an inch closer....closer....

With a sadistically gleeful cry the pigtailed girl burst from her hiding place. The small pink-haired girl gasped in surprise and began to turn to face her. Too late! With quick precision, Usagi grabbed at the wet towel the younger girl had wrapped around herself just after her bath. At the same time, she pushed with all her might to force the shocked girl through the open back door. The motion was fluid so that by the time Chibiusa realized she was now out in public she was already bereft of her only garment and the door was already being closed and latched before she had time to scream.

Usagi's laughter was high pitched, almost enough to drown the pounding and screaming from her pre-teen sister (okay, okay, preteen time displaced daughter of her 1000 year old future self...but in case anyone asks, her sister). Usagi provided a little victory dance and mockingly waved the towel back and forth as the naked girl furiously glared at her through the transparent door. Nothing better than a good prank successfully executed!

After a stern scolding from her mother, a furious death glare from a beat red Chibiusa, and a delicious meal Usagi was still giggling to herself as she read a manga in her room. She was starting to get minor guilt pangs that her little joke had gone a little too far, but mostly she was still too delighted with the look on her bratty little counterpart's face to dwell on it. There was a genuine rapport between the two moon girls. But it was often a love-hate relationship, with the pair often arguing or engaging in antics of oneupmanship between the concern and adoration. A lack of enemies to fight and a long summer had bred a sense of boredom in the blonde haired superhero, and Chibiusa was the perfect way to relieve it.

Or so she thought.

When Chibiusa entered the room and gave her another glare, Usagi couldn't help but titter.

"Ah, Usa-chan! There you are! I almost didn't recognize you with your clothes on!!" Usagi said animatedly.

Chibiusa didn't respond and instead headed towards the closet containing her suitcase.

"Uh-oh. No come backs. So we're not talking then?" Usagi asked towards Chibiusa's back. "That's okay. I know it was a little mean. Still worth it, though. The look on your face! Especially when that neighborhood boy snapped the picture! Awwww. You had a crush on him, didn't you! That must be embarrassing!"

Chibiusa turned around slowly. She had something in her hands.

"Do you remember this, Usagi?" She asked in a stony voice.

"....." Usagi paused, a hint of uncertainty in her voice. "Sure. That Luna P, that future gizmo thingy that looks like a floating kitty head. It changes into different objects, right?"

"Mmmm-hmmmm. And do you remember this?" Chibusa asked as Luna P vanished in a puff of smoke.

"Yeeeeaaaah. That's...that umbrella thing. That's how you convinced everyone you were my little sister visiting from out of town and conned your way to living here." Usagi said.

"And you know how I did that?" Chibiusa asked, twirling the umbrella.

"....Yeah....the...eep...the umbrella does some kind of hypnosis on whoever looks at the pattern when it moves." Usagi said, a little dismayed to find herself unable to look away from the pattern.

"Very good. Did you know I can do more than alter memories? Like, for example...force them to do whatever I tell them to?" Chibiusa asked.

"I....no. I didn't know that." Usagi said in a small voice.

"That's what I thought. Stand up." Chibiusa said, still glaring.

Usagi whimpered as she found herself obeying the command.

"Ummm....Chibiusa-chan...." Usagi said.

"Yes?"

"Can...can I please just apologize for earlier?"

"Of course you can. Feel free. Apologize as much as you want. Beg for forgiveness. See if it helps." Chibiusa said.

Usagi gulped as Chibiusa gave a wicked smile.

114.content:
In the annals of the Sailor Scouts the man known as Mamoru Chiba is something of an aberration. As wit all the Senshi he was born as both the guardian and mythical embodiment of a planet or celestial body. And as it happened, his guardian world was the Earth itself. Under normal circumstances that would have made him one of the most powerful entities in the Sol System. But for reasons understood only to the nebulous forces of the universe the powers of a Sailor Senshi could only be fully unlocked by a female incarnation. Being the only male in a group of mystical warriors largely doomed Tuxedo Mask to fall behind his comrades. While he was easily the equal of any of the Inner Senshi when they had first awakened, the girls had the ability to awakened stronger forms (first their Super states, and later the Eternal transformation). Tuxedo Mask thus had to rely on his wits and the base abilities his status granted him- superhuman reflexes and agility, a cane capable of extending to incredible lengths, and of course his trademark ability to manifest roses with thorns sharp enough to penetrate virtually any defense.

Fortunately, none of this really mattered to the princess of the Senshi. Usagi cared far more about their shared history (a tragic romance between the kingdom of the moon and Earth that had been cut short due to the manipulations of Queen Beryl and the utter annihilation of the Sailor Senshi...or rather A annihilation of them). She still had unresolved feelings from a past life, which made for a vaguely understood but firm determination for a better outcome this time around. Also...he was hot. As seemed to be consistent with every example of the Senshi, he was a well built, athletic, and extremely good looking example of his sex (another apparent inexplicable rule of the universe- there were no ugly or even average Senshi- each was physically stunning and beautiful, some subtly alluring and others simply drop dead gorgeous- which perhaps was all too appropriate for men and women embodying the legends of planets and gods from times long past). Or, to put it more simply- all the Senshi looked good naked, and Mamoru was no exception. Or so Usagi had every reason to believe. Perhaps tonight was the night to find out!

So where exactly is Mamoru?

1213.content:
Author's Note: Dragging this guy out of the deep, dark recesses of Sailor V manga hell. Just a word of warning.

A very familiar laugh echoed down the alleyway. Minako faltered just as she was about to transform.

"...Ace?" She said in shock.

Fair to say that fate had always played a strange role in the life of the Sailor Senshi. Old truimphs and tragedies from their first lives as Princesses and Guardians of their respective worlds were often revisited in their modern lives. The obvious example was the romance between Sailor Moon and Tuxedo Mask. But for Minako there was the peculiar parallels that popped up between her and Usagi. Both carefree blondes with a love of fun and an abiding hatred for schoolwork, both tossed into the world of the senshi by a feline mentor...and both protected by a mysterious masked guardian. For Usagi that was her Mamoru. For Minako it had been Ace Kaitou, a celebrity by day and hero by night. Where Tuxedo Mask used razor sharp roses, Phantom Ace (as he was also known) used equally deadly playing cards as his signature attack. He had saved young Minako from death more times than she could count.

He was supposed to be dead. She knew this because she was the one who killed him.

"You look more beautiful than ever, Venus." said the silver haired man as he strode into the alley, his carefully tailored uniform a match for his hair. Not for the first time Minako was struck by his resemblance to Helios in his human guise (minus the horn, of course)...if somewhat older and a bit colder in demeanor.

".....HOW? How can you be here?" Minako whispered, her head spinning.

"My, you seem surprised. All the times you were able to cheat death with that silver imperium crystal, yet it surprises you that I had a way to do the same?" Ace smiled humorlessly.

"Its been so long since...I killed you." Minako said, her eyes wide.

"Yes, well...I wanted to be completely certain that you had exhausted your supply of enemies. I wanted your full attention, and I know how easy it is for the Lady Venus to be caught up in her duties." Ace said with a touch of bitterness.

So many millenia ago Ace had been called Adonis, a lonely soldier assigned to guard Venus and her castle. The poor fool had been instantly smitten with her beauty and dedication. Busy as she was with the protection of the Solar System, the young princess had never thought more of him than a dependable servant in her entourage. Still he loved her enough to take that in stride, knowing she would never have time for such trifles as romance, wishing that one day he might have the power to change their fates. And fate gave him that chance by reincarnating him into the modern world, even as it cruelly set him on a very different path.

"You didn't leave me any choice. You know that! If I had let you survive you would have hurt so many people!" Minako said.

"Heh. I did TRY to fight my fate, Princess. I helped you as much as I could as the Phantom Ace. But I had another role to play. The Dark Kingdom found me before we had a chance to meet again. As Danburite I was required to be your enemy. And you destroyed me, as I knew you would. Then and now it was always duty before love."

"I DID love you." Venus whispered. "Killing you hurt more than anything I ever did."

"Which I suppose means I served both my masters when I made you love me." Ace chuckled to himself.

",,,,What do you want? What path are you following anymore? Your Dark Kingdom is dead, and I'm not a princess anymore. So what is this all about? Revenge? A second chance? What path are you walking now?"

"Hmmm....maybe both. Maybe neither. I've had a chance to think over these past few years. And honestly...I've haven't had any fun at all. That's our problem, Venus. All work and no play."

Minako smirked despite her unease. "I know how to play just fine, Kaitou."

"Do you? You put on a carefree air, but is that the truth? I've seen below the mask a few times already, Miss Aino. Evenafter years of peace you still wrap yourself up in your duties. Oh, you've had many lovers, but I doubt you've ever really BEEN in love."

"....I had a bad experience." Minako said, glaring at him.

"I know. But that's the problem, isn;t it? You and I have always been servants. Adonis served you, and you served the moon princess. Now you STILL serve the moon princess, and Danburite served your enemies. No wonder I thought I couldn't change our fates. We've spent all our lives doing what others told us. I think from now on I choose my own path. No more bowing to anyone else's will. I want to see what its like to be in control. To dominate. And then too...I want to free you from the shackles you've bound yourself in."

".......I don't know what your talking about. But I'm happy where I am now! And its not like I can just start trusting you again, especially with an entrance like you just made!"

"That's very smart of you, Minako-chan. I'm no longer on the Dark Kingdom's side, but that doesn't mean I'm standing with the light again. In fact, I think its safe to say I'm on no one's side except my own. But you misunderstood. I don't expect you to trust me. I'm just here to have fun with you. Whether you like it or not."

"....Tch. You may not have noticed, Ace, but we've been fighting evil for a long time now. I'm officially one of the strongest Senshi in the Galaxy! You won't stand a chance."

"Oh? Then show me!"

"VENUS STAR POWER, MAKE UP!"

Ace smiled thinly as Minako began her transformation. Her clothes dissolved as a warm orange glow suffused her body. A magical starburst came gushing from her wand, encircling her nude form in a lovely little light show. But in one fluid motion Phantom Ace let a single card fly in the midst of the transformation. Minako cried in surprise as the projectile struck the transformation wand, knocking it out of her hand. The wand clattered to the ground, the starburst continuing to swirl around it. A moment later the orange stars flew upward in a dramatic circle all around the wand. Jewels, gloves, shoes, and a white on orange fuku blinked into being in midair....and fell uselessly to the floor as the wand had inexplicably found itself out of range of the young girl it was expected to clothe.

Minako was now quite naked save for the ribbon in her hair. Her eyes growing as wide as dinner plates, she let out a shrill scream and tried to cover herself. It wasn't terribly effective.

"I'm from the swim team, and, well..." How would she convince them to leave her be, or maybe even help?

154.content:
The Sailor Senshi have many secrets. Somewhere on the Moon, overlooking the Sea of Serenity, lies the ruins of a vast city and a magnificent castle. Whether by luck or some bit of magical protection lingering from the days of the Silver Millenium, none of innumerable probes, telescopes, or visitors making one small step on the moon's surface have discovered this particular ruin. This was the grand court of the Senshi in a forgotten age. And as one might expect, such an edifice contains secrets within secrets.

One of those secrets is a doorway deep within the inner keep of the castle. Behind that door, in a physical sense, there is only the white stone that makes up the walls of the castle. That's because the door doesn't connect to a place so much as a WHEN. It connects to the dangerous pathways of Time. Walk those paths long enough you could end up centuries in the past or in a time yet to come. And should you so desire, you could alter the present or the future by manipulating events in one of these other times.

That of course is exactly why this door and the passages beyond have their own guardian.

Setsuna Meiou, otherwise known as Sailor Pluto (Pluu to her friends) is by far the greatest enigma amongst the Senshi. Supposedly she had stood as a lonely sentinel of Time for the whole span of human history. That was probably true, technically speaking. The problem with a door that literally exists both outside of and yet concurrent with every point in human history is that it makes measuring the exact length of Pluto's tenure here almost impossible. If the Senshi are not in effect immortal and eternally young, then at the very least they age at an absurdly slow rate beyond a certain age (witness how the Senshi one thousand years from the present appear, at most, to be in their twenties!). Guessing Pluto's true age is therefore impossible, especially considering that her mastery of Time allows her to leave her post to (for example) help Michiru and Haruka raise a baby Sailor Saturn for however long that requires then pop back half a second after she left and take up her guardianship yet again!

What little is known about her is that, while on watch, she appears inexpressibly lonely. The only friend to speak of is the occasional visit from Chibiusa, the daughter of Sailor Moon and Tuxedo Mask born roughly a thousand years from now. She seems much happier in the present, living with her fellow outer senshi and their adopted (potentially world destroying!) daughter. Per the manga, Setsuna works as a nurse in the school that Hotaru (Sailor Saturn) currently attends, and taking care of sick children is one of the few times she appears unabashedly happy.

What relationships Pluto has had are obviously few and far between. Some sources say she had an unrequited love for Tuxedo Mask that she never followed through on. Less tragically, living together with a lesbian couple and helping them raise a child certainly suggests that Setsuna could have a more than casual relationship with Michiru and Haruka. That being said, her years (centuries? Millenia?) alone keeping watch over Time has left her rather quiet and reserved. In some ways she is kindest member of the Outer Senshi, usually showing sympathy where Neptune and Uranus show aggression. Yet she is also the most fatalistic, for who knows better what is to come than the Senshi of Time? More generally, being cut off from human contact has made her reclusive by nature. The Senshi aside, her only meaningful contact with anyone tended intruders trying to get through the Time Door. For that reason, she prefers to avoid strangers as much as possible and limit her contact to her friends. Of all the Senshi, she is perhaps the least comfortable with dealing with awkward situations, strong emotions, or intimate relationships due to the simple fact that such things have been few and far between for her. For someone so closed off and constantly on guard, let alone a woman who may have gone hundreds of years without another human being seeing or touching her, the mortifying situation Pluto is about to find herself in is no doubt going to be especially hard for her to deal with.

Speaking of which, where was Pluto when her unfortunate circumstances began?
154.title: Sailor Pluto

1543221.content:
Usagi and her friends had planned for a nice, relaxing weekend. It wasn't just a hot spring after all, it was also a resort inn, complete with a restaurant, comfortable rooms, separated bathing areas, the works.

There were only two rooms for the five of them, so it hadn't taken long for them to decide.

The cheerful blonde leader had gone along with Rei and Minako, while Ami and Makoto(easily the calmer of the five) had taken the second one. Once they had their things put away, they went straight for the hot springs, towels in hand.

But things weren't going to go as well as they had hoped... a certain youma had been waiting for the perfect opportunity to strike back at the senshi for years of humiliation against their kind, and what better way than to humiliate them back?

The question of 'when' was easy. The five would be left in nothing more than towels, perfect targets.

The question for the hidden creature was 'how', and of course... 'who'?
1543221.title: This story

choices: The youma waits to make its move.
15432211.content:
The youma smiled evilly to itself as it watched the senshi enter the hot springs, nothing on hand for them to protect their modesty with but towels. Yes, the youma decided, this was perfect - for years, the senshi had brought humiliation on their kind, now it was time to return the favor. And they themselves had provided the opportunity for it, which was almost as sweet as the act itself would. But how to start?

Well, after some thought, the first step seemed obvious. So, the youma went to the changing rooms where the senshi had left their clothes and belongings, and with a snap of its fingers, made them all disappear into thin air. Now the youma really were left with nothing but their towels.

Now the hard decision. Should the youma wait for the senshi to emerge from the hot springs so it could watch their panic at finding their clothes gone, or should it do something else to further add to their humiliation immediately? And if so, what could it do? After all, there were so many options available to it.

Finally, the youma made its decision and...
15432211.title: The youma targets all five at once.

154322112.content:
No, the youma wasn't going to wait. It was going to rain so much humiliation down on the senshi that they'd never be able to show their faces in public again. And that meant striking now, and doing everything in its power to ruin them.

Still, that left so many options available to actually humiliate them with. So many ways that being naked in a semi-public place could go wrong in a horribly embarrassing way. So, the question remained, what was the youma going to do?

After several more minutes of thought, the youma laughed evilly as it decided to...



Option 1: Switch around the hot springs' signs, marking the one the senshi are in as the men's room, and waiting for someone to stumble on the bathing senshi.

info.brief_description: Sailor Moon and her allies find themselves in a variety of embarrassing predicaments.
info.description:
A story created on request for a Sailor Moon ENF, based mainly around the anime. The general guidelines are the same as found in all my other stories. A brief overview:

Guide the selected character through a series of events that leave her stark naked, far from cover, and completely embarrassed. While the character may find something to cover herself up with, it generally shouldn't last for too long (think a couple chapters at most).

In this particular story, please keep in mind the setting. Unless a character is travelling, they should be in Tokyo, Japan, where the series takes place.

General restrictions-
No scat, gore, vore, shrinking, growing, rape (other forms of sex allowed, subject to removal at my discretion), transformation, and the like.

Now, for a basic rundown of the characters.

Sailor Moon (Usagi Tsukino)- http://sailormoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sailor_Moon_(anime)
Leader of the Sailor Senshi, yet arguably one of the least mature. While she has grown into her role as a hero, she is still known to have her "crybaby moments".

Sailor Venus (Minako Aino)- http://sailormoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sailor_Venus_(anime)
Soldier of Love and Beauty, Venus is a dreamer. Hoping to be a famous performer one day, the perky youth attends auditions whenever the opportunity arises.

Sailor Mercury (Ami Mizuno)- http://sailormoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sailor_Mercury_(anime)
Soldier of Water and Wisdom. The quiet bookworm of the group. Rumored to have an IQ of 300, she is easily the smartest of the bunch. While she puts forth a shy exterior, this hides her love for pop culture and romance novels.

Sailor Mars (Rei Hino)- http://sailormoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sailor_Mars_(anime)
Soldier of Fire and Passion. Elegant and serious, though a tad boy crazy and short-tempered. As a shrine maiden, Rei is gifted with limited precognition, allowing her to occasionally glimpse bits of the future. Unlike the rest of the Senshi, Sailor Mars attends a private Catholic school, separate from her friends.

Sailor Jupiter (Makoto Kino)- http://sailormoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sailor_Jupiter_(anime)
Soldier of Thunder and Strength. A bit of a tomboy, and easily the strongest of the Senshi in terms of physical prowess, Makoto is certainly unlike the average Japanese girl. As an orphan, Makoto lives alone and takes care of herself, having developed skills in housekeeping, cooking, and gardening.

Sailor Uranus (Haruka Tenou)- http://sailormoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sailor_Uranus
Soldier of Sky and Fury. A year older than most of the other Senshi. An excellent driver with dreams of becoming a racer, Uranus is more of a tomboy than even Jupiter, preferring to dress and even speak like a man in most situations.

Sailor Neptune (Michiru Kaiou)- http://sailormoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sailor_Neptune
Soldier of the Ocean and Embrace. An elegant and wealthy girl, as well as a talented violinist and painter. Neptune has given up her own dreams, instead devoting herself fully to her duties as a Senshi, willing to make any sacrifice for the sake of her duty.

Sailor Pluto (Setsuna Meiou)- http://sailormoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sailor_Pluto
Soldier of Time and Space. A bit of a mystery to the rest of the Senshi, having come to earth from outer space. While her personality is distant and her demeanor stern, she is capable of being quite friendly, and aids the other Senshi when she can. Her time in space has left her with a feeling of great loneliness.
